body: Sorry; one change did not go through originally. Branch replaced.

I think nbexec is fine as it is. For my current use-case it would be sufficient to better share code (inheritance) between app.exe and netbeans.exe. BUT that would probably require some changes in the config as well - it would become more similar to NB's .conf file (same replacements etc).
If that is acceptable, I'll prepare the change.

@jlahoda Could you rename ` ide/launcher/windows/Makefile.migw` to ` Makefile.mingw` ?

Otherwise the build process worked OK for me, tested on Windows 7.

The patch is clean and has tests but it would take me some time to understand what you did there as I'm not familiar with the area. It would be nice to see Miloslav Metelka show up here.

I see you show the line wrap character only if `isNonPrintableCharactersVisible` is true but honestly I don't know which GUI setting toggles this.

The isNonPrintableCharactersVisible setting can be triggered via the "Toggle Non-printable Characters" action--I assigned it a keyboard shortcut in the Preferences pane to be able to invoke it.

Yeah, when I looked at the historical "git blame", Miroslav was the one who wrote all the related logic (most of it back in 2010).

I have added a few more known issues related to word wrapping in the NetBeans editor, in case anyone who knows the code strolls through and wants to comment:

https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/NETBEANS-978
https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/NETBEANS-979
https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/NETBEANS-980

(Fixing these few word wrapping bugs would increase the IDE's value as a general-purpose editor rather than just a code editor, at least for people who like to write long paragraphs of text without explicit line breaks. Though my own motivation for getting these fixed is because my spreadsheet-like NetBeans Platform application uses the NetBeans EditorKit for its table cell editor and formula bar.)
I've sent an email to ask about Miloslav, let's hope he'll show up soon.
Great.

As far as I remember there should be already such a code adding -Xmodule for non project sources.
The `org/netbeans/modules/java/source/parsing/ModuleOraculum.java` in `java.source.base` should do this.

With regards to the problems with the Arrow Up/Arrow Down/Home/End actions in wrapped paragraphs, I've done some investigations that I typed up in https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/NETBEANS-980 (also closing NETBEANS-979 as a duplicate of the latter, since they turned out to be variations on the same problem).

But this pull request can be reviewed and applied independently of those other issues.

@tzezula, thanks, I didn't realize there's such a class. It does depend on working (-XD)-Xmodule, though, which does not work on vanilla javac. But I realized that with custom FileManager, it is possible to emulate that, so that's what the current patch is trying to do. (We could use -Xmodule, but not -XD-Xmodule, instead of a newly introduced -Xnb-Xmodule: option, but it seemed better to be to use option that that would make it clear it is a NB-only option.)

Good work. 
I think you would have to also update the Updater Splash in "ide.branding". So far, you have only updated the Updater Splash for the Platform, as far as I can tell.

See [NETBEANS-146](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/NETBEANS-146) for more details.
importfqns is now invoked on only the moved class.

@eirikbakke, how confident are you about this patch, you're currently the most knowledgeable in this area and we should try to not necessarily rely on Oracle staff anymore as far as possible. If there are specific areas where you need help or are less confident about, please say so, but on the face of it this looks like an awesome enhancement that we should accept.
I don't think there are objections to this, i.e., including the new splash screen, so I'm going to merge it.
I don't think there are objections to this, i.e., including the new splash screen, so I'm going to merge it.
I don't think there are objections to this, i.e., including the new updater image so I'm going to merge it.
OK, let's merge. But this is for 'master', not 'release90', must that be done as well?
I'm loving the modern look. The IDE needed it! Should we use those colors in the default IDE theme?

I think it should be possible to be even more strict, and rewrite only identifiers, but I guess we can live with the proposed state for now. Please file a bug to investigate how to improve the code (and to add tests).

I am not really an expert in this area, but looks reasonable to me.

Very cool. Should we wait to relicense everything in the 2nd donation or integrate this there already?
@eirikbakke pls. did you test your feature with the **java shell** editor ? It does weird things with down/up/begin/end to avoid entering the prompt. Just check if the changes did not break it.
Logged https://issues.apache.org/jira/projects/NETBEANS/issues/NETBEANS-1005

I'm not sure but some people (e.g. @JaroslavTulach, @sdedic, @dbalek ) did the same thing in the 1st donation.
Furthermore, I have 8 patches for new features. When I worked on them, I didn't push them because new feature phase was already past. So I just attached them to each issue. e.g.
- https://netbeans.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=267470
- https://netbeans.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=251395
- https://netbeans.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=132066
- https://netbeans.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=270929
e.t.c.

I would like to merge them as soon as possible because I'm not sure whether I can apply patches correctly after license headers are changed.

If there is a problem, I'll just wait :)
Thanks!
Are there any that need to be reviewed or should we merge them all without additional steps? Up to you, either way, happy to do what you think best.
I suppose we need not review them. I hope that they are merged if anyone else has no objection. I'll wait a while.
Very cool. I think @jglick should take a look at this.
OK, merging.
Would be good for at least @sdedic to comment, and let's merge then.
@jlahoda, should we merge, and into release90 too?
So, should this be merged only for JDK 11 and onwards, i.e., not in release90, which is not aimed at JDK 11?

Seems it is safe for other versions, the test build passed with 1.8. Though this may not work for post Java 11, as it seems its [deprecated](https://github.com/dmlloyd/openjdk/blob/jdk/jdk/src/jdk.javadoc/share/classes/com/sun/javadoc/SourcePosition.java#L42), also mentioned in [JDK 10 docs](https://docs.oracle.com/javase/10/docs/api/com/sun/javadoc/SourcePosition.html)

It was not an issue under JDK 10 or 9. This is only a JDK 11 fix. It can wait till a release that targets JDK 11. No rush, more a heads up to issues with JDK 11. If not merged that is fine. There maybe a better solution for long term, as SourcePosition is set for removal. I just had to do that for JDK 11, so figured I would submit a PR.

@emilianbold I'd like you to review this. It is another license update. The first commit is just whitespace cleanup and update of the license for the entity definitions. I think with the clarification, that the W3C considers the files to be distributed under the W3 software license we should be safe.

The maven.coverage situation is a bit different. These files are not from the W3C and IMHO the license statement referring to ISO is bogus in this case. The important thing is, that the cobertura DTDs don't define entities, so you can actually completely parse a coverage report from cobertura without accessing the DTDs, you just can't verify the files. As the DTDs are not necessary and the license situation is unnclear, I modified the module to use a non-validating parser. I manually checked, that the code coverage support in the IDE works before and after the change.
Probably, in this case, we should not squash & merge because it would be big one commit and it would be hard to find specified changes...
I can test that. Will have to get back to this in a little while... in the middle of another deadline and a laptop switch.

There is one issue that I see now--since there is less margin on the right now, putting the cursor at the last character on a wrap line makes the editor scroll horizontally by a few pixels to put it fully into view, even if the last character is just a whitespace. I should probably fix that before the patch is applied.

Now busy with another deadline; will revisit in a couple of weeks.
I pushed an updated changeset, that removes the unintended whitespace change. I think this is good to go.
If someone has no objection, I'll merge this later.
@sdedic Should I add the tokenID? or Can I merge this?

I didn't study this in detail, but should JavadocTI.DOT be also used for
the Japanese dot? I.e. there would be a single token ID returned for both
(all) kinds of dots. In any case, I'd keep the test for highlighting, that
seems useful to ensure the functionality does not regress.

Possibly. But `DOT` is used inside tags, as qname part delimiter (IDENT DOT IDENT HASH IDENT). If japanese dot char becomes `DOT`, then `{@link org<japanesedot>netbeans ...`) will be interpreted as qname.
I'm not sure where impact area of that change is because I'm not an expert of Java area...
Thank you for the feedback. I'll merge as is.
Could you comment on my original fix https://reviews.apache.org/r/67721/ and mention the bugs you found?
done
Good, I think.

The patch seems ok to me, I just do not have all the details regarding the line wrapping code cached in my memory right now.
Visibility of a speacial char denoting line continuation depends on a personal preference and I do not have a strong opinion regarding this. We can imho have it as proposed i.e. only show it when View->Show Non-printable Characters is turned on.
Merging this, but we also need it in release90.
I don't believe this is controversial, :-), simply redoing the earlier merge of the updated About box text from main to release90. So, merging.
created PR #623, for backport to release90 branch.

This shouldn't prevent anything from working, or break anything, I propose we accept this into release90 even though it is not a blocker, also because it impacts one of the main features of the release90 release, i.e., the 'var' support.
I think it is a good idea to accept this into release 90.
Any reason not to merge this?
i consider it low risk, because ant 1.10.4 was a minor revision and no actual code is changed in netbeans.
Aside from 'master' does this also need to be in 'release90'?
Maybe @emilianbold should handle this PR because he is the author of the original fix.
Please check Jan's PR https://github.com/apache/incubator-netbeans/pull/616 if any changes required in tests.

@emilianbold i've tried to give you proper attribution:
 applied: 0001-NETBEANS-781-Upgrades-Ant-to-1.10.4.patch

from: Emilian Bold <emilian.bold@protonmail.ch.INVALID>
is in the comments of the commit.
if this is not enough, please use your id when merging.

@sijskes you are listed as the author in the commit. Git allows you to differ between the committer and the author. The author is the one that created the initial changeset, the committer is the one integrating the changeset. In many cases these two are identical, in other case (here) they are not.

If a git formated patch is supplied, the easiest way for integration is:

- change into the root of the project you are working with
- fetch the patch: `wget -O diff.patch https://reviews.apache.org/r/67721/diff/raw/`
- apply it with git: `git am diff.patch`
- remove the patch: `rm diff.patch`

After this, the changeset is commited to the branch, the executing user is set as the committer, the author is set as author.

This is the result:

```
matthias@athena:~/src/incubator-netbeans$ git log -n 1 --pretty=fuller
commit 388b27ff749de94b979dc2097e571fd0ca721140 (HEAD -> test)
Author:     Emilian Bold <emi@apache.org>
AuthorDate: Mon Jun 25 20:16:57 2018 +0300
Commit:     Matthias Bläsing <mblaesing@doppel-helix.eu>
CommitDate: Wed Jul 4 20:17:15 2018 +0200

    Upgrades Ant to 1.10.4
matthias@athena:~/src/incubator-netbeans$ 
```

Maybe this helps.
PR #616 is not affecting  my PR changes , I had verified

Found this while checking through vc3 and wondering why that action was still broken.  Guess it didn't get cherry-picked in time?!

IMO this link should be to something under `https://netbeans.apache.org/nb/....` though.  We can set up a redirect from there to JIRA.  The idea was to give us a common root URL for everything inbound from the IDE.

My Proposal:

1. Merge this PR
2. Create a new issue for improving this in the JIRA

That way, someone other than me also may be able to work on it. I suppose that the person can do it even if the person doesn't know the Japanese language because I added test cases for it.

Only if we need to create a new vc should we include this in release90, I think, unless I'm wrong. We should simply merge it into main, that's all, imho.
Many thanks for doing this, merging.

To me, looks good, pity we won't have this in 9.0, unless a new vc will need to be made. Anyway, is there any reason why this should not be merged? Thanks for the investigation and time you must have needed to identify this problem in the code.
Good from my point of view, added @sdedic for a review too.
Was this needed because the new splash screen makes the location of the progress bar and text look strange or something? Great, if so, just wondering about the reason.

OK, @eirikbakke, its been reviewed in different ways now, even by @mmetelka, just say the word when you're done -- and/or if more reviews are needed after you make further tweaks -- and then let's merge this cool enhancement.

sure no problem, It must be stressed that, this is the first time i have submitted a patch for Netbeans, and hence not familiar with the Netbean's source code as a whole. This patch was just to allow my team to continue with its evaluation of Netbeans 9 with our existing embedded java products. However if you are happy with it, then I see no reason why it can't be merged
Very nice, thanks. More incisive pull requests such as this are more than welcome.

I think we will make another vote candidate (9.0.1?) immediately after the 9.0 release to include this too.

It's sad the Apache process takes so much time (3+ days for PPMC vote another 3+ days for IPMC vote -- there goes a full week minimum for any fix). I guess this was the reason this PR was not included: we already started a vote and would have had to start over to include it...

Yup.

And your idea for making another vote candidate asap after the 9.0 release with various pull requests, such as this one, sounds great. On the other hand, we also have the idea of a new release every three months, so, well, anyway, we can discuss this on the dev mailing list rather than here.

A few observations:
- `Go to symbol` seems not to be implemented with the `documentSymbol` message
- Custom lsp actions are not implemented, e.g. the `codeLens` or `codeAction` LSP messages

Great! I've actually prepared a few more commits that should be reviewed as part of this patch (improving horizontal scroll behavior in view of the new wrapping policy). But before I push them for review, I'd like to make sure I'm not breaking any existing unit tests.

I'm having trouble [1] running unit tests for the editor.lib2 module, even before the patch is applied. Is anyone able to run the test suite successfully, in particular for this module?

[1] "task failed due to: java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: org/netbeans/editor/GuardedDocument", e.g. in org.netbeans.modules.editor.lib2.highlighting.HighlightingManagerTest. See email thread on the dev list with subject "Does Travis and/or Jenkins run the NetBeans test suite?"
OK, merging this PR.
@sdedic Please review the changes and provide the your valuable feedback.
Thanks, merging.
